snippet: Two previously unpublished letters written by Jane Austen’s brother Charles could shed a suggestive and unexpectedly saucy light on the ways her literary reputation was kept alive after her death in 1817.
abstract: Two previously unpublished letters written by Jane Austen’s brother Charles could shed a suggestive and unexpectedly saucy light on the ways her literary reputation was kept alive after her death in 1817.

headline.main: Pride, Prejudice, Prostitutes and Pickles: Scholars Unearth Two Letters Relating to Jane Austen
